intro: Limeum argute-carinatum var. kwebense, commonly known as the Kwebense spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant in dry gardens.
